newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks seen flat in slow trading.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks seen flat in slow trading.

text.p: Jakarta stocks are seen flat in slow trading on Tuesday as sentiment remain cautious ahead of the Thursday's general election, brokers said.
"Bargain-hunting in some big-caps is likely to continue, but trading volume is likely to stay small because of the cautious sentiment ahead of the election day," one broker said.
Semen Gresik was expected to remain among the targets of bargain-hunting. At its Monday's closing price of 5,650 rupiah, the cement maker was considered attractive, brokers said.
Smal-capitalised property firm Mas Murni was likely to stay active on continued market talk of a possible take-over, brokers said.
Brokers said a lack of fresh corporate news was also seen keeping the market slow.
The Jakarta composite index rose 4.67 points to close at 663.20 points on Monday.
The broker said buying these stocks could provide huge gains, provided the timing was right.
Shares belonging to the Lippo Group, including Lippo Securities, Lippo Land and Lippo Land were among the gainers, but volumes were small, brokers said.
